document_data.name: Two Sisters
document_data.author: [[Veseene|Veseene the Lark]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Two Sisters''''' was a short poem composed by [[Veseene|Veseene the Lark]] about the goddesses [[Shar]] and [[Selûne]].
document_data.Contents:
The narrative poem was composed of four stanzas—three quatrains and an ending couplet. It followed a broken [[wikipedia:Anapest|anapest]] tetrameter rhythm. The tale described the birth of the two sisters, their battle, and the creation of [[Mystryl]]. The following is a translation of the second stanza: : ''At the dawn of the world, two sisters contest''
: ''Over dark, over light, over life, over death.''
: ''Shar seeks the void and with shadows coalesced''
: ''Snuffs Selûne's bright lights and with them her breath!''
document_data.History: The ballad was presented to [[Dhauna Myritar]], high [[priest]]ess of [[Moonshadow Hall]] in [[Yhaunn]], [[Sembia]], in the {{YearlinkName|1360}}.
